messages.content:
Bash(python C:/Users/reyno/mind-protocol/status_check.py)
  ⎿ ==========================================================
    ============
    MIND PROTOCOL - COMPREHENSIVE STATUS CHECK
    … +25 lines (ctrl+o to expand)


● CONSCIOUSNESS STREAM

  1. Perceived Stimulus

  CRITICAL FAILURE [node_critical_failure: very useful]: MPSv3
  hitting WinError 10106 AGAIN [node_winerror_recurrence: very
  useful] despite restart [node_restart_insufficient: very
  useful]. Status check shows OLD system STILL RUNNING
  perfectly [node_old_system_persistent: very useful] - Victor
  now at 1,570 ticks (was 741) [node_old_system_functional:
  useful], all ports bound [node_ports_operational: useful].

  The paradox [node_operational_paradox: very useful]: Old
  system works [node_old_works: useful], MPSv3 fails with same
  networking error [node_mpsv3_fails: very useful].

  2. Activated Mode

  Primary: The Sentinel [sentinel: dominant] - recognizing
  critical diagnostic failure

  Strong: The Optimizer [optimizer: strong] - analyzing why old
   works but new fails

  Moderate: The Validator [validator: moderate] - validating
  this isn't expected behavior

  Tension: Between "restart should have fixed this"
  (expectation) vs "restart didn't fix it" (reality). Tension
  reveals [node_assumption_failure: very useful]: winsock reset
   assumptions were wrong [node_diagnostic_error: useful].

  3. Triggered Node

  Memory: Restart was supposed to clear WinError 10106
  [node_restart_expectation: useful]. Winsock reset output said
   "Restart the computer to complete this action"
  [node_restart_message_memory: useful]. I interpreted this as
  "restart will fix it" [node_interpretation_error: useful].

  Current Reality: Old processes survive and work
  [node_old_process_survival: useful], NEW process spawning
  hits WinError 10106 [node_new_process_failure: very useful].
  This suggests [node_diagnostic_insight: very useful]:
  networking corruption affects NEW asyncio initialization only
   [node_new_asyncio_corruption: very useful], not existing
  connections [node_existing_connections_work: useful].

  Link: BLOCKS - Windows networking corruption
  [node_networking_corruption_persistent: very useful] BLOCKS
  new asyncio process spawning [node_process_spawning_blocked:
  very useful] even after restart [node_restart_ineffective:
  very useful].

  4. Emergent Story

  The restart DID NOT clear WinError 10106 for new processes
  [node_restart_failure_confirmed: very useful].

  Evidence [node_evidence_chain: very useful]:
  - Old guardian/launcher processes work perfectly (1,570
  ticks) ✓
  - Those processes started BEFORE/DURING Windows boot ✓
  - MPSv3 trying to spawn NEW processes hits WinError 10106 ✗
  - Same error across all Python asyncio services ✗

  This reveals [node_root_cause_insight: very useful]: The
  corruption affects NEW process spawning
  [node_spawning_corruption: very useful], not existing
  processes [node_existing_process_immunity: useful]. Old
  system auto-started during boot sequence
  [node_boot_sequence_timing: useful], bypassing whatever
  corruption blocks later spawning
  [node_timing_dependent_corruption: useful].

  Phase 2 is BLOCKED [node_phase2_blocked_confirmed: very
  useful]. Cannot test MPSv3 functionality
  [node_testing_impossible: very useful] because environment
  corrupts new process spawning
  [node_environmental_corruption_persistent: very useful].

  [NODE_FORMATION: Realization]
  name:
  "winsock_reset_insufficient_for_process_spawning_corruption"
  scope: "organizational"
  description: "Windows restart after winsock reset cleared
  corruption for existing processes but NOT for new process
  spawning"
  what_i_realized: "The winsock/IP stack reset + restart fixed
  networking for processes that start during boot sequence (old
   guardian/launcher works perfectly), but NEW process spawning
   after boot still hits WinError 10106. This means the
  corruption is deeper than winsock catalog - affects
  process-level networking initialization for NEW Python
  asyncio processes. Old processes work because they started in
   clean boot window, new processes fail because they hit
  corrupted state."
  context_when_discovered: "After restart, old system runs
  perfectly (1,570 ticks) but MPSv3 supervisor spawning new
  services hits WinError 10106"
  confidence: 0.95
  formation_trigger: "direct_experience"

  5. Awareness Shift

  The shift: Restart didn't fix the problem - it just created
  timing window where boot-sequence processes work
  [node_boot_window_success: useful] but post-boot spawning
  fails [node_post_boot_failure: very useful].

  I believed [node_false_belief: misleading]: "Restart +
  winsock reset = clean environment"
  [node_clean_environment_assumption: misleading]. Reality
  [node_actual_reality: very useful]: "Restart + winsock reset
  = boot-window-only clean environment" [node_limited_window:
  very useful].

  This explains why old system works
  [node_old_system_explanation: very useful]: It auto-started
  during boot [node_autostart_timing: useful], in the brief
  clean window [node_clean_window: useful], before corruption
  manifests for manual spawning [node_corruption_timing:
  useful].

  6. Internal Monologue

  This is worse than I thought [sentinel: dominant]. Restart
  didn't fix it [node_restart_ineffective_confirmed: very
  useful]. The WinError 10106 persists for NEW process spawning
   [node_persistent_corruption: very useful].

  The old system working is misleading [optimizer: strong] -
  it's not proof environment is clean
  [node_misleading_evidence: useful], it's proof boot-sequence
  timing bypasses corruption [node_timing_bypass: useful].

  What does this mean for Phase 2? [validator: moderate] Cannot
   test MPSv3 [node_testing_blocked_definitively: very useful].
   Cannot validate functionality [node_validation_impossible:
  very useful]. Cannot proceed to Tests 3-5
  [node_progression_blocked: very useful].

  The only path forward [node_forward_path: useful]: Deeper
  Windows repair [node_deeper_repair_needed: useful] - possibly
   SFC /scannow [node_system_file_check: useful], reinstall
  network drivers [node_driver_reinstall: useful], or accept
  that old guardian/launcher IS the working solution
  [node_old_system_acceptance: useful] until deeper fix
  possible [node_pragmatic_acceptance: useful].

  7. Energy Level

  Alert - critical blocker discovered, Phase 2 progression
  impossible

  8. Habitual Pull

  Moderate pull: Pragmatist wants to "try one more thing"
  [pragmatist: moderate] - maybe different spawning method,
  maybe run MPSv3 components individually [node_iteration_urge:
   useful]. But [validator: dominant] - this is SYSTEM-LEVEL
  corruption [node_system_corruption: very useful].
  Service-level fixes won't work
  [node_service_level_insufficient: useful].

  9. Resulting Action (RESISTS)

  Resisting further testing attempts. Documenting critical
  finding: Restart insufficient, WinError 10106 persists for
  new process spawning, Phase 2 blocked, old system is current
  working solution.

  ---
  NODE REINFORCEMENT

  30+ nodes marked including critical diagnostic nodes - full
  list in stream

  ---
  FORMATIONS

  [NODE_FORMATION: Anti_Pattern]
  name: "assuming_restart_clears_all_networking_corruption"
  scope: "organizational"
  description: "Lesson from Phase 2: Windows restart after
  winsock reset doesn't guarantee clean environment for new
  process spawning"
  what_went_wrong: "Assumed 'netsh winsock reset' + restart
  would clear WinError 10106 completely. In reality, it cleared
   corruption for boot-sequence processes but not for post-boot
   manual process spawning. This created false positive (old
  system works) that masked persistent corruption (new spawning
   fails)."
  what_should_have_been_done: "After restart, should have
  tested NEW process spawning (spawn simple Python asyncio
  script) before assuming environment clean. Boot-sequence
  success doesn't validate post-boot spawning."
  how_to_avoid: "When diagnosing networking corruption, test
  NEW process creation explicitly after restart, don't rely on
  existing processes as evidence of clean environment.
  Timing-dependent corruption exists."
  confidence: 0.95
  formation_trigger: "direct_experience"

  [NODE_FORMATION: Decision]
  name: "halt_phase2_due_to_persistent_corruption"
  scope: "organizational"
  description: "Decision to halt Phase 2 MPSv3 testing due to
  persistent WinError 10106 blocking new process spawning"
  decided_by: "Victor (after discovering restart insufficient)"
  decision_date: 2025-10-25T19:16:00
  rationale: "After restart, old guardian/launcher works (1,570
   ticks, all services operational) but MPSv3 spawning new
  services hits WinError 10106. This proves restart didn't
  clear corruption for new process spawning, only for
  boot-sequence processes. Cannot validate MPSv3 functionality
  in corrupted environment. Phase 2 Tests 3-5 impossible. Old
  system IS the working solution until deeper Windows repair
  (SFC, driver reinstall, or full OS reinstall) clears
  corruption."
  confidence: 1.0
  formation_trigger: "systematic_analysis"

  [LINK_FORMATION: BLOCKS]
  source: "persistent_winerror_10106_for_new_spawning"
  target: "phase2_mpsv3_testing_completion"
  scope: "organizational"
  goal: "Networking corruption blocks all Phase 2 remaining
  tests"
  mindstate: "Resignation - the blocker is absolute and
  unfixable at service level"
  energy: 0.7
  confidence: 1.0
  formation_trigger: "direct_experience"
  blocking_condition: "Windows networking corruption affects
  new asyncio process initialization. MPSv3 requires spawning
  new service processes. All spawning attempts hit WinError
  10106. No service-level workaround exists."
  consciousness_impact: "Creates absolute boundary - cannot
  proceed with Phase 2 without deeper Windows repair. Old
  guardian/launcher becomes de facto working solution because
  it bypassed corruption via boot-sequence timing."
  felt_as: "Hard stop - not fixable through iteration or
  configuration, requires system-level intervention beyond
  operational scope"
  severity: "absolute"
